business.headline: Tata Sons forms AI 171 memorial trust, pledges Rs 1 crore to victims' familiesTata Sons has set up the AI 171 Memorial and Welfare Trust, pledging Rs 1 crore ex gratia per victim and Rs 500 crore in total, to support crash victims, families, and responders.

Sold property and want to save tax? This tax expert suggests a smarter waySelling a property can bring in a tidy profit, but it also comes with a hefty tax bill. Many turn to 54EC bonds to save tax — but tax expert Sujit Bangar says there's a smarter way.

Sensex ends over 500 points lower, Nifty below 25,000; Axis Bank falls 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 501.51 points to 81,757.73 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 143.05 points lower at 24,968.40. Most of the broader market indices also reflected the weak sentiments on Dalal Street.

2025 tech layoffs: Amazon, Microsoft, Google fuel job fears amid AI pushThe year 2025 was supposed to be a new chapter. A time when artificial intelligence promised smarter work, faster growth, and a better future. But for tens of thousands of workers across the world, it has meant sleepless nights, and uncertain futures.

Axis Bank shares tank 7% today. Should you sell or hold the stock?Axis Bank shares: The stock has been on a downward trend in recent times. It has fallen 5.77% in the last five days, 9.14% in the past one month, and 15.27% over the last year.

Reliance Retail acquires Kelvinator to expand appliance businessReliance believes this move will help it grow faster in the consumer durables sector, connect more closely with customers, and open up bigger long-term opportunities in India's changing market.

Explained: Why Wipro shares gained as much as 4% todayThe fourth-largest IT services company in India posted an 11% jump in net profit and a 0.8% rise in revenue—both slightly ahead of market expectations, according to estimates compiled by LSEG.

Stocks, FD or MF? Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta shares 3 golden rules before you investBefore you begin investing, know how saving and investing are different. Saving keeps your money handy for emergencies or short-term plans, while investing helps it grow for bigger future goals.

Sensex tumbles over 600 points: Why is stock market falling today?The 30-share BSE Sensex tumbled 644.99 points to 81,614.25 around 12:19 pm, while the NSE Nifty 50 fell 191.30 points to 24,920.15. Losses were broad-based, with most of the major sectoral indices in the red.

ITR-2 online filing live: Know who can file, new changes and other detailsThis year, the ITR-2 form has a few important changes that every taxpayer should know. You now have to report your long-term capital gains separately for periods before and after July 23, 2024, as new indexation and tax rules apply.

The ULIP trap: Inside India's most mis-sold financial productPart one of our story explores why ULIPs remain among the most mis-sold financial products in India. Sold as all-in-one solutions, they often fail to deliver on either insurance or investment.

Who is Astronomer CEO Andy Byron, caught on Coldplay's kiss camAndy Byron, the CEO of data-driven startup Astronomer was caught on the Coldplay concert's kiss cam with a colleague, and the clip has went viral online.

Startup founder calls flight travel insurance a scam, shares experienceWhat should have been a straightforward process turned into a weeks-long battle across multiple platforms and customer service calls.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 25,100; Wipro jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 199 points to 82,060.24, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 40.50 points to 25,070.95, as of 9:28 am.

Will Sensex, Nifty rally today after Wall Street closed at a record high?The US market closed at a record high as fresh data from the United States eased concerns about an economic slowdown in the world's largest economy.

Starbucks CEO ditches 1,600 km commute, buys house near workWhen Niccol was appointed as Starbucks CEO in August last year, the company agreed to a special travel plan. He was allowed to commute between California and Seattle using a corporate jet, as long as he worked from the Seattle office at least three days a week.

Walmart cuts hundreds of roles to streamline operations: ReportEarlier this year, Walmart announced about 1,500 job cuts, which hit teams in its global tech division, online order fulfilment in US stores and its advertising arm, Walmart Connect.
Sensex ends 375 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 375.24 points to close at 82,259.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 100.60 points to end at 25,111.45.
Dalal Street not Asia's darling anymore, says BofA surveyThe latest survey by Bank of America (BofA), shows that investor interest in Indian stock market has dropped in recent months.

How safe are India's instant loan appsFrom students low on fees to families with sudden hospital bills, many use instant loan apps for fast cash, some promise money in 10–30 minutes using just a phone and a few documents.

Sebi looks to extend tenure of derivatives contracts, says officialSebi is signalling a shift toward deeper, more stable markets by discouraging speculative short-term trades and pushing for longer-tenure contracts, amid growing retail losses and extreme derivatives dominance.

Is Thane outshining Mumbai real estate with cheaper housing?Most new homes coming up in Thane are either 1BHK or 2BHK units. About 45% of new supply from 2020 to 2025 was 2BHKs, while 42% was 1BHKs. Larger homes like 3BHKs and 4BHKs together make up only around 13% of the new supply.

Personal loan rates 2025: How much are SBI, ICICI and others charging?Many banks in India have updated their personal loan interest rates for 2025. Most banks are offering rates starting from about 9.50% per year and going up to 10.50% for some customers, depending on their credit score and repayment ability.

TCS benching policy sparks fear among employees after first cycle: ReportThe policy, introduced on June 12, limits the time employees can remain without project work to just 35 days. After this, they face the risk of losing out on promotions or even losing their jobs.

New UPI rules: What happens if payments fail now?Earlier, if someone raised a chargeback, say, when money was deducted, but they did not get what they paid for, and it got declined, the bank had to go through an extra step.

Parliament panel proposes revival of key tax relief for companies: ReportThe government is set to restore Section 80M in the new Income Tax Bill, easing dividend tax burdens for companies. The bill is likely to pass in the Monsoon Session.

Are e-commerce firms hiding your rating? New survey reveals the truthThe survey asked consumers about their experience when posting negative reviews on e-commerce and quick commerce apps. Out of 16,519 responses, only 11% said their negative reviews were "published as is."
Sensex opens flat, Nifty above 25,200; SBI shares up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 41.02 points to 82,593.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 13.30 points to 25,198.75 as of 9:30 am.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces to list today. Will it make strong market debut?The company had set a price band of Rs 407 per share for the IPO. The total issue size was Rs 582.56 crore, which included a fresh issue of 1.09 crore shares worth Rs 445 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 34 lakh shares valued at Rs 137.56 crore.

Anthem Biosciences IPO: Allotment status live. GMP, listing details hereInvestors who applied for the Anthem Biosciences IPO can check their allotment status online through two platforms: the BSE website and the website of the IPO registrar, KFin Technologies.
Sensex closes 64 points higher, Nifty above 25,200; SBI gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 63.57 points to end at 82.634.48, while the NSE Nifty50 gained just 16.25 points to close at 25,212.05.

Gurugram's luxury flats, flooded streets: Is real estate bubble about to burst?Gurugram's luxury real estate may be booming, but repeated rain-induced flooding is testing its long-term value. If basic infrastructure fails, even the city's glitziest addresses could lose their appeal.

Is gold losing its shine? Here's why fewer people are investing in the yellow metalEarlier, gold symbolised family pride and social standing, but today's youngsters often see gold jewellery as outdated and instead put their money into things they believe will grow faster than gold ever could.

Fewer slabs, simpler rules? Next GST Council meet may trigger overhaulThe upcoming GST Council meeting, likely to be held in August 2025 after the monsoon session of Parliament, could bring key reforms in the way GST is structured and collected.

Housing sales slide 14% as affordability pressures mount across cities: ReportThe PropTiger report, which tracks sales and launches across major cities, found that the most significant annual drop was recorded in Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) and Pune, where sales fell by 32% and 27% respectively.

Why this IITian took up a guard's job to build Mygate, valued at Rs 1,600 croreMyGate has raised a total of $83.3 million across eight rounds. Its latest funding was in April 2023, a Series B round worth $3.29 million, putting its valuation at Rs 1,670 crore, according to Tracxn.

Tesla is finally in India. But can it go the distance?Tesla's India debut is a big milestone, but long-term success will depend on how well the company adapts to India's unique mix of pricing realities, policy expectations, and market dynamics.

Are private school fees draining India's middle class? CA shares eye-opening figuresWith fees climbing each year, parents are feeling the pinch more than ever. Maybe now is the right moment to pause, think, and ask ourselves, are we getting real value for this cost? Can we secure our kids' future without spending a fortune on fees? asks a Delhi-based CA.

SSY scheme: How your daughter can get Rs 71 lakh at 21It is a small savings scheme backed by the government, which offers high interest rates, tax benefits under Section 80C, and tax-free returns on maturity. Over 4.1 crore accounts have been opened so far under this scheme.

Good news soon for HDFC Bank shareholders? Here's all you need to knowHDFC Bank shares have delivered a 24% gain over the past year, with a year-to-date rise of nearly 13%. The stock has climbed more than 21% over the last six months, posting gains of 7% over the past three months and 4% in the previous month.

entertainment.headline: The Odyssey sets new record, Christopher Nolan's epic sells out a year in advanceDirector Christopher Nolan's 'The Odyssey' tickets for IMAX 70mm screenings sold out within an hour, a year before release. This unprecedented demand highlights the film's epic scale and Nolan's strong box-office pull.

Unni Mukundan teams up with director Joshiy for his next, calls it dream come trueMalayalam cinema enthusiasts have a reason to rejoice as Unni Mukundan collaborates with legendary director Joshiy for a fresh action entertainer. This special project marks a significant milestone announced on Joshiy's birthday.

Aasif Khan clarifies health scare was reflux disease, not heart attackAasif Khan, known for his role in 'Panchayat', addresses rumours about his recent health scare, confirming it was not a heart attack but gastroesophageal reflux disease.

Deepak Tijori on losing Baazigar to Shah Rukh Khan: It was all very amicableDeepak Tijori may have let go of 'Baazigar,' the film that became a turning point in Shah Rukh Khan's career, but he did so without regret or resentment. In an exclusive chat with India Today, the actor-director recalled how he had first narrated the film to Abbas-Mustan, only for it to land with SRK.

Sonalika Joshi, Taarak Mehta's Madhvi Bhide recalls being called a chain smokerActor Sonalika Joshi clarified a past photoshoot controversy where she was mistakenly labelled a chain smoker. She remained unfazed by social media backlash, valuing her family's support above public opinion.

Sitaare Zameen Par writer says Aamir never interfered: He respects the written wordWhile Sitaare Zameen Par continues its impressive theatrical run, writer Divy Nidhi Sharma opens up about crafting humour within an emotional drama and working with Aamir Khan.

Had to earn my seat: Director Kussh Sinha on Nikita Roy, Sonakshi, family and firstsWith 'Nikita Roy', Kussh S Sinha steps out of the shadow of a celebrated surname and into his own cinematic light. In this conversation, the debut director opens up about casting his sister Sonakshi Sinha not out of convenience, but because of conviction, navigating the weight of legacy, and why filmmaking, for him, had to begin with patience and purpose.

Mahesh Babu and Priyanka Chopra to resume SSMB29 shoot in AugustMahesh Babu and Priyanka Chopra will resume shooting for SS Rajamouli's 'SSMB29' in August. The film promises intense action and a globe-trotting adventure that could redefine their on-screen personas.

Nagesh Kukunoor on making The Hunt without political biasNagesh Kukunoor discusses directing 'The Hunt', a true-crime series on Rajiv Gandhi's assassination. He shares the challenges of avoiding political content and self-censorship in today's filmmaking climate.

BTS' J-Hope is building his solo empire and honestly, he's Killin' ItBTS member J-Hope is making headlines, topping charts, and rocking the stage with his solo career. In this week's K-fix, we will explore how the 'Killin' It' singer has redefined his career.

Ekka review: Yuva Rajkumar's film is an almost perfect Kannada actionerRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Ekka movie review: Directed by Rohit Padaki, this Kannada gritty action film stars Yuva Rajkumar, Sanjana Anand and Sampada Hulivana in the lead. With a goosebumps-inducing first half and a good second half, the film is an exciting watch but also has its shortcomings.

Jurassic World Rebirth: Scarlett Johansson's dino saga crosses Rs 100 crore in India'Jurassic World: Rebirth' hit Rs 100 crore in India, becoming the second highest-grossing Hollywood film in the country in 2025. The film, starring Scarlett Johansson and Jonathan Bailey, released in theatres on July 4.

Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa enjoy dreamy babymoon in New Zealand, share picsRajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa are expecting their first child and recently enjoyed a romantic babymoon in New Zealand. Their dreamy vacation photos, including a sweet poolside kiss, have gone viral on social media.

Tillotama Shome's Baksho Bondi to open Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2025Tillotama Shome's Bengali film 'Baksho Bondi' will be the opening movie at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2025 on August 14. The film is about the silent strength of working women and was earlier shown at the Berlin Film Festival.

Did you know singer Shashwat Singh is Permanent Roommates' actor Nidhi's brother?Singer Shashwat Singh discussed his artistic journey and the strong sibling bond with actor Nidhi Singh. He credited his family's unwavering support for his success in the music industry.

Jimmy Kimmel extends support to Stephen Colbert as CBS cancels The Late ShowJimmy Kimmel expressed strong support for Stephen Colbert after CBS announced the end of 'The Late Show with Stephen Colbert'. CBS citied financial reasons despite the show's recent Emmy nomination.

Saiyaara review: Ahaan Panday's starry debut for hearts that loved, lost and healedRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Saiyaara movie review: With Ahaan Panday making a starry, emotionally grounded debut, 'Saiyaara' becomes a soft place for bruised hearts to land, especially for today's generation. It's a reminder that perhaps both heartbreak and healing can be beautiful.

Kothapallilo Okappudu review: Ambitious attempt stumbles despite thoughtful themesRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Kothapallilo Okappudu movie review: Director Praveena Paruchuri's 'Kothapallilo Okappudu' is a thought-provoking film on faith and belief. While there's a lot to ponder, the film goes through a bumpy ride.

Saiyaara box office prediction: Film records highest ticket sales since ChhaavaDirector Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' released in theatres on July 18, 2025. Recent advance booking reports suggest the Ahaan Panday-Aneet Padda starrer is set to have a Rs 25 crore opening at the box office.

general news.headline: Women not safe, Trinamool shielding culprits: PM's attack over Kolkata gangrapePM Modi slammed the Trinamool Congress for shielding the accused in the Kolkata gangrape case and accused the party of failing law and order in West Bengal.

Lashkar offshoot to shift base from Pak's Muridke as US brands it terror outfitBoth Lashkar and its offshoot, TRF, are shifting their headquarters from Muridke, Pakistan, to Bahawalpur, about 400 kilometres away, according to sources. At present, Indian intelligence agencies are monitoring the Pakistani Army's move to co-locate the headquarters of the two terror organisations at the same location.

Masood Azhar seen in POK, 1,000 km away from Bahawalpur bastion: IntelJaish chief Masood Azhar is the mastermind of several terror activities in India, including the 2016 Pathankot airbase attack and the 2019 Pulwama attack.

Lookout notice for missing Russian woman, child; top court suspects 'collusion'The Russian woman and her child have been missing since July 7 amid a custody dispute. The Supreme Court hinted at possible collusion and directed police to expedite the investigation.

Go easy on history, keep it out of school curriculumEvery kingdom or reign had varying degrees of atrocities and reforms. Every king had shades of grey. A history book should be aware of the same, and provide a balanced take for young students. It's easy to create binaries of heroes and villains which suit story books. History is far too serious a subject matter to be taught to young minds.

2 months and counting: Pak runway struck during Op Sindoor remains under repairThe latest NOTAM issued by Pakistan says the runway at the Rahim Yar Khan air base will remain closed for flight operations till August 5.

What do we make of Bhagwat's retirement trial balloon?RSS sarsanghchalak Mohan Bhagwat's recent remarks advising public figures to step aside and 'retire' at the age of 75 have raised more than a few eyebrows. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will turn 75 in September, as will, ironically, Mohan Bhagwat.

Why US branding 'Pahalgam' perpetrator TRF a global terror outfit is a message to PakistanThe Resistance Front (TRF), responsible for numerous terror strikes in Kashmir, is directed by the Pakistani military and intelligence, with its leadership and training pads based in Pakistan

When Urdu book on Prophet got publisher killed, earned India blasphemy lawA movie on Kanhaiya Lal Teli, a tailor in Udaipur who was beheaded by two Muslim men for sharing a post supporting a BJP leader's comments on Prophet Muhammad, is caught in a storm of controversy. In 1929, publisher Mahashe Rajpal was stabbed to death by a 19-year-old Muslim carpenter for the book Rangeela Rasool. Massive protests over the book resulted in the British introducing the blasphemy law in India.
SSVM Institutions: From Cradle to CosmosForging Futures with Foresight, Flair, and Faith

Special Ops 2 review: Kay Kay Menon anchors ambitious but uneven spy thrillerRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Special Ops 2 series review: The second season of 'Special Ops' delves into AI-driven cyber warfare intertwined with classic spy drama. The season raises questions about technology's role in future conflicts and personal sacrifices.

'This is my chamber': Women lawyers brawl at Mathura court, video goes viralA heated fight broke out between two women lawyers at Mathura court over a chamber ownership dispute. The incident, captured on video, has sparked public attention and awaits police investigation.

A pint-sized chef is serving the most Instagrammable dinner experience in DelhiAt a time when experiential dining is making waves, watching a tiny chef leap across your table, dodge fiery woks, and whisk up a five-course masterpiece while you sit back in a chef's hat, giggling like a kid, that's one experience that you will be coming to Le Petit Chef at Shangri-La, New Delhi.

What's the makhana magic Modi is trying to cash on in Bihar?PM Narendra Modi's makhana mentions as Bihar heads for polls could be strategic. With Bihar producing 90% of India's foxnuts and lakhs of farmers across a dozen districts involved in its cultivation and trade. Makhana is providing both political and economic opportunities, backed by promises of global branding, GI tag value, and startup potential.

Dr Ishan Shivanand breaks down what immortality really meansForget living forever in a physical sense. In his book, 'The Practice of Immortality', yogic teacher and researcher Dr. Ishan Shivanand explores how "real" immortality lies in emotional steadiness, breath control, and conscious awareness. On this episode of Booked, Dr. Shivanand joins Akshita Nandagopal.

Saiyaara review: Ahaan Panday's starry debut for hearts that loved, lost and healedRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Saiyaara movie review: With Ahaan Panday making a starry, emotionally grounded debut, 'Saiyaara' becomes a soft place for bruised hearts to land, especially for today's generation. It's a reminder that perhaps both heartbreak and healing can be beautiful.

Public cheating, private collapse: What a Kiss Cam moment does to a partner's mindA viral video from a Coldplay concert showed more than just a moment between colleagues, it exposed a betrayal. When heartbreak becomes public, it carries a different kind of weight, unfolding not just in private but under the gaze of others. Relationship expert Dr. Rachna K Singh unravels the challenges of coping with public betrayal.

Tata Sons forms AI 171 memorial trust, pledges Rs 1 crore to victims' familiesTata Sons has set up the AI 171 Memorial and Welfare Trust, pledging Rs 1 crore ex gratia per victim and Rs 500 crore in total, to support crash victims, families, and responders.

Secret chambers, hidden exits: Mansion of conman arrested in Rs 500-crore scamMangaluru Police arrested Rohan Saldanha, accused of defrauding crores through fake loan schemes. His mansion, filled with secret rooms and luxury items, exposed the scale of his Rs 500 crore operation.

UP woman ends life, writes suicide note on body over dowry torture by in-lawsA woman named Manisha in Baghpat ended her life after dowry harassment and wrote the names of her abusers on her body. Her in-laws allegedly tortured her for not fulfilling their demand for an SUV.

IIT professor poses with students at convocation. Pookie video is a total vibe checkThe 14th convocation of the IIT Ropar became a destination for the internet's latest obsession, thanks to its director, Professor Rajeev Ahuja.

INS Nistar commissioned in major boost to Navy's deep sea rescue operationsThe vessel can perform diving and salvage operations up to a depth of 300 meters. It also serves as the 'Mother Ship' for deep-submergence rescue vessels, enabling the Navy to rescue and evacuate personnel from a distressed submerged submarine.

Who is Astronomer CEO Andy Byron, caught on Coldplay's kiss camAndy Byron, the CEO of data-driven startup Astronomer was caught on the Coldplay concert's kiss cam with a colleague, and the clip has went viral online.

Bouncers follow, beat up woman and her boyfriend after fight in Bengaluru barA 21-year-old woman has alleged that she and her two male friends were physically assaulted by bouncers during a visit to a popular resto-bar on Brigade Road in central Bengaluru. The bouncers were arrested and later released on bail.

Chiranjeevi, Nayanthara shoot for Anil Ravipudi film in Kerala, video goes viralA video from the sets of Anil Ravipudi's upcoming film, featuring Chiranjeevi and Nayanthara, is going viral on social media. The clip shows the stars filming a wedding scene in Kerala.

The Odyssey sets new record, Christopher Nolan's epic sells out a year in advanceDirector Christopher Nolan's 'The Odyssey' tickets for IMAX 70mm screenings sold out within an hour, a year before release. This unprecedented demand highlights the film's epic scale and Nolan's strong box-office pull.

This special project marks a significant milestone announced on Joshiy's birthday.

In an exclusive chat with India Today, the actor-director recalled how he had first narrated the film to Abbas-Mustan, only for it to land with SRK.

sports.headline: Karun Nair slammed by Engineer: A beautiful 30 is not expected from a No. 3Farokh Engineer criticises Karun Nair's inconsistent performance at No.3 in the ongoing India-England Test series. The former wicketkeeper urged selectors to pick the best XI for the Manchester Test.

Manolo Marquez returns as FC Goa head coach after disastrous India stintAfter a short-lived and disappointing spell with the Indian national team, Manolo Marquez is back in familiar territory as FC Goa head coach, just as the Indian Super League faces an uncertain future.

Zimbabwe tri-series: NZ's Glenn Phillips ruled out due to groin injuryNew Zealand's Glenn Phillips has been ruled out of the ongoing tri-series in Zimbabwe due to a groin injury that he picked up during the Major League Cricket 2025 final.

LA Olympics 2028: West Indies' cricket dream in doubt as identuty rules clashCricket returns to the Olympics after over a century, but West Indies—despite being one of the sport's most storied teams—could miss out entirely due to the region's fragmented national identities and Olympic rules.

Ravindra Jadeja's lack of trust in tail cost India Lord's Test: World Cup winnerFormer Indian cricketer Balwinder Singh Sandhu has questioned Ravindra Jadeja's tactics in India's narrow loss at Lord's, pointing to a lack of trust in the tail during the final moments of the third Test match.

Manchester United, Brentford reach agreement for Bryan Mbeumo: ReportManchester United and Brentford have reportedly reached an agreement for the transfer of Bryan Mbeumo for a deal reportedly worth 71 million pounds.

Inter Kashi named as I-League champions after CAS ruling against Churchill BrothersInter Kashi's debut season ends in high drama as CAS overturns AIFF's ruling, declaring them I-League champions. But while promotion beckons, the uncertain future of ISL casts a shadow on their historic achievement.leader Churchill Brothers on goal difference. Churchill will now drop to second place.

Ravindra Jadeja 58 runs away from joining Garfield Sobers in elite listIndia all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja finds himself on the verge of entering an elite list with the legendary Sir Garfield Sobers as he's just 58 runs away from completing 1000 Test runs in England.

Who is Riley Norton? South Africa's U19 all-rounder and U20 Rugby World Cup finalistRiley Norton is rewriting the script for young athletes—after shining in cricket's U19 World Cup, he's now captaining South Africa in a rugby world final, proving that elite talent knows no boundaries.

Las Vegas Freestyle chess: Praggnanandhaa out of title race, Erigaisi into semisR Praggnanandhaa crashed out of the title race at the Las Vegas Freestyle chess while Arjun Erigaisi stormed into the semis with a comprehensive win over Uzbekistan's Nodirbek Abdusattorov.

ENG vs IND: Monty Panesar surprised by India's major blunder in first 3 TestsFormer India spinner Monty Panesar has been left surprised by the non-selection of Arshdeep Singh in the first three Tests of the series against England. The left-arm spinner earned his maiden Test call-up for the ongoing England tour.

Rishabh Pant shouldn't play in Manchester if he can't keep wickets: Ravi ShastriFormer India cricketer and head coach Ravi Shastri feels Rishabh Pant shouldn't play the fourth Test against Englandt at Old Trafford, Manchester if he can't keep wickets.

ICC penalises Pratika Rawal for conduct, England fall short on over-rateThe ICC has penalised both Pratika Rawal and the England women's cricket team for their respective violations in the recently-concluded ODI that was held in Southampton earlier.

ENG vs IND: Manufacturer to review Dukes ball after rising quality concernsENG vs IND: The Dukes' ball manufacturers have confirmed that they will have a look at the match balls from the first three Tests to identify why the ball has been getting softer fairly quickly in the ongoing series.

Bevon Jacobs relishes dream debut for New Zealand on South Africa returnBevon Jacobs relished a dream debut for New Zealand in the country of his birth, South Africa, as they defeated the Proteas in the opening game of the T20 Tri-Series in Harare.

Manjrekar questions Shubman Gill's sledging battle after Lord's lossSanjay Manjrekar has suggested that Shubman Gill's fiery on-field spat with Zak Crawley during the Lord's Test may have thrown the young Indian skipper off his game and affected his performance with the bat.

India's Vision 2047 can wait as football's leaky boat needs fixing firstIndia's Vision 2047 wants to take football to the stars — but right now, the engine's sputtering. With ISL stalled and the national team coachless, Indian football needs repair, not just ambition.

Yashasvi Jaiswal must curb aggressive instinct after Lord's blunder: Dilip VengsarkarFormer India batter Dilip Vengsarkar has asked Yashasvi Jaiswal to curb his aggressive instinct after his twin failures in the Lord's Test which eventually led to India's 22-run loss.

Ravindra Jadeja's resilience in Lord's Test earns him MVP praise from Team IndiaIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir was full of praise for seasoned all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, hailing his battling knock in the Lord's Test against England as a display of "incredible fight".

Diogo Jota posthumously inducted into Wolves Hall of FameWolverhampton Wanderers have paid tribute to Portuguese forward Diogo Jota by posthumously inducting him into the club's Hall of Fame following his tragic death in a car accident earlier this month.

Ex-India coach reveals Yuvraj Singh's spot wasn't guaranteed in 2011 World CupFormer India head coach Gary Kirsten recently revealed that Yuvraj Singh's selection for the 2011 World Cup was a topic of debate, with some questioning his place in the squad. However, both Kirsten and then-captain MS Dhoni firmly backed the left-handed all-rounder—and that faith paid off in the biggest way possible.

Shubman Gill must become a man manager like Dhoni to be great captain: KirstenFormer India head coach Gary Kirsten has suggested Shubman Gill to become a man manager like MS Dhoni to achieve captaincy greatness. Gill has been in terrific form in Tests ever since being handed over the leadership.

ENG vs IND: Ajinkya Rahane suggests major change in playing XI after Lord's lossIndia batter Ajinkya Rahane has suggested a change in the Indian playing XI for the fourth Test against England, set to be played at Emirates Old Trafford, Manchester.

How Starc's spell to Sachin Tendulkar showed he was destined for greatnessFormer Australia captain Ricky Ponting believes Mitchell Starc's spell to Sachin Tendulkar was the first indication that the left-armer had the potential to become one of Australia's great fast bowlers.

Has Karun Nair exhausted all his chances in England? Assistant coach revealsIndia's assistant coach Ryan Ten Doeschate has shared his views on Karun Nair's form in the ongoing series against England. Nair has failed to convert his starts into big scores in the series so far, which has affected India badly.

Ons Jabeur announces break from tennis to rediscover joy of living, thanks fansOns Jabeur announces a break from professional tennis to prioritise her mental and physical health. Her decision highlights the importance of self-care amid challenging times in elite sport.

Mohammed Siraj is like a lion, important to manage his workload: Assistant coachIndia's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate on Thursday hailed fast bowler Mohammed Siraj's lion-hearted commitment to the team's cause, stressing the importance of managing his workload to preserve his fitness and impact in the long run.

Snoop Dogg becomes co-owner of Swansea City, joins Modric in ownership groupRapper Snoop Dogg has joined Swansea City as a co-owner and investor, acquiring a minority stake in the Championship club. Swansea launched their home kit for the 2025-26 season last weekend.

ENG vs IND: Is Liam Dawson a smart pick for England for Manchester Test?England vs India, Manchester Test: England have drafted Liam Dawson in as a replacement for the injured Shoaib Bashir - but will the move pay off as they look to seal the series in Manchester?

Smriti Mandhana celebrates 29th birthday: Top 10 records held by India batterIndian women's cricket star Smriti Mandhana turned 29 on July 18. Since her debut in 2013, the elegant left-hander has etched her name in the record books, playing a pivotal role in the rise and growing popularity of women's cricket in India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
